alert.note: Alert for Chelan (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 15 at 2:13PM PDT until May 22 at 4:27PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Spokane WA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Washington... Stehekin River at Stehekin affecting Chelan County. .Warm temperatures this week into next weekend will melt high mountain snowpack and result in increased river flows. For the Stehekin River...including Stehekin...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WATCH... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Stehekin River at Stehekin. * WHEN...Until Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, The river may be out of its banks in spots on parts of Stehekin Valley Road and Company Creek Road, especially from Harlequin Bridge to about seven miles upstream. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 PM PDT Monday the stage was 23.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 22.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon and continue rising to a crest of 25.3 feet late Wednesday morning. It will then rise to 25.7 feet early Friday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 25.7 feet on 05/15/1949. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 700 AM PDT.
